alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:03PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cheshire County through 245 PM EDT... At 202 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Guilford Center, or near Brattleboro, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Keene, Jaffrey, Winchester, Dublin, Harrisville, Nelson, Gilsum, Marlborough, Hinsdale, Roxbury, Walpole, Sullivan, Alstead, Westmoreland, Swanzey, Chesterfield, Surry, Troy and Marlow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern and central New Hampshire.
